description.narrative: Expanding Access to Finance for MSEs: Micro and Small Enterprises ("MSEs") play an important role in creating employment and contributing to local economy particularly in less developed regions. Nevertheless, MSEs are under-served by traditional financial institutions. The expansion of the Companies will help address the issue by increasing credit supply accessible and affordable by MSEs; Supporting Economic Growth in Frontier Regions: Frontier regions in China have experienced much pronounced difficulties in access to finance for MSEs, which hinders the economic growth in these regions. The Companies, operating Sichuan Province which is a frontier region, will expand access to credit in the region, specifically to MSEs, thereby supporting the continued growth of the local economy.

The proposed investment consists of IFC senior loans of up to US$14.5 million equivalent denominated in RMB to an existing client MicroCred Chinas two subsidiaries - Microcred Nanchong (MC Nanchong ) and Microcred Sichuan (MC Sichuan, or together the Companies). MC Nanchong and MC Sichuans major operations are lending to micro or SME businesses in Sichuan province in China. The proposed investment is consistent with IFCs China Strategy and Global Microfinance Strategy, particularly in increasing access to finance for the underserved - the micro and small business enterprises and the self-employed mass market. The project would facilitate a stable source of long-term funding which would help the Companies grow their business in Sichuan Province, a frontier region in China.
